definition: business in which a company has traditionally engaged (e.g. before diversifying)/original business/core business/(literary) agriculture
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: The goods or services purchased are not for the use of principal and ancillary business operation.
sentences.chinese: 二非供本業及附屬業務使用之貨物或勞務。

sentences.english: Means to do the Bank in this industry?
sentences.chinese: 指做本行本業的事，成績特別顯著。

sentences.english: The precondition of doing part time jobs is to fulfill one's primary occupation first.
sentences.chinese: 做兼職的前提是應先做好自己的本業。

sentences.english: At last, they forget their devotion to his original mission.
sentences.chinese: 最後忘記了對他們本業應有的關注之心。

definition: to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax

employee/person employed in a trade or profession
